text.section:
The Frederick County Board consists of eight members as follows:
Seven members elected from the county at large; and
One nonvoting student member.

section.section: A candidate elected to the county board shall be a resident and registered voter of Frederick County.
Any member who no longer resides in the county may not continue as a member of the board.
A voting member serves for a term of 4 years beginning the first Tuesday in December after the member's election and until a successor is elected and qualifies.

Voting members of the Frederick County Board shall be elected as follows:
Three members of the county board shall be elected in the November general election of 2000 and every 4 years thereafter; and
Four members of the county board shall be elected in the November general election of 2002 and every 4 years thereafter.
The terms of voting members are staggered as provided in subsection (c) of this section.
The County Commissioners shall appoint a qualified individual to fill a vacancy on the county board for the remainder of the term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session.
Before removing a voting member, the State Board shall send the member a copy of the charges against the member and give the member an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.

If the voting member requests a hearing within the 10-day period:
The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the voting member a notice of the hearing; and
The voting member shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in the member's own defense, in person or by counsel.
A voting member removed under this subsection has the right to a de novo review of the removal by the Circuit Court for Frederick County.
